thread.title: Hubble spots mother lode of 250 ancient tiny galaxies
thread.title_full: Hubble spots mother lode of 250 ancient tiny galaxies

title: Hubble spots mother lode of 250 ancient tiny galaxies
text:
Hubble spots mother lode of 250 ancient tiny galaxies 
Cnet Saturday 24th October, 2015 
The Hubble Space Telescope has been in operation since 1990 and it still can amaze scientists and space fans alike. A team of astronomers has used the Hubble to make a fascinating discovery that links back to the early days of our universe: a collection of over 250 dwarf galaxies. Researchers date the galaxies to an estimated "only 600-900 million years after the big bang." That sounds like a long time to us, but it's a pittance on the scale of the universe's life span. NASA notes that it took over 12 billion years for the light from the galaxies to reach the Hubble. The galaxies aren't just i...
